column1: These columns are the data that will be displayed in the periodic table.  Each cell in this worksheet should be a reference to a cell in the "Full Data" worksheet.

column11: The purpose of this worksheet is to selectwhich data from the "Full Data" worksheet(tab) will be displayed in which locations inthe "Periodic Table" worksheet (tab).Each cell in the "Periodic Table" worksheetis a reference to the corresponding cell inthis worksheet.  If you change the contentsof a cell in this worksheet, the change willshow up in the corresponding location on theperiodic table.  The box above shows wherethe data in each numbered column will bedisplayed.Each cell in this worksheet is a reference(pointer) to a correspoding cell in the "FullData" worksheet.  To change which data isdisplayed here (and therefore on the periodictable), select the cell in the first data row(hydrogen) of the column that you want tochange.  Edit the formula for the cell sothat it points to the column letter in the"Full Data" worksheet that contains the datathat you want to have displayed.  Then copythe cell you just edited, and paste it downthe entire column, for elements 1 through118.  Excel will edit the formula so thateach cell points to the corresponding cell onthe "Full Data" sheet.  (Try it a few timesto see how it works.)Because the column headings are displayed inthe key at the top of the periodic table,remember to edit the column letter in theheading to match.
